concise_definition: v. 纵容, 放任, 沉溺

definitions.explanation_en: To allow oneself or someone else to enjoy something pleasurable, often to an excessive or unrestrained degree, especially when it may be considered improper or unhealthy.
definitions.explanation_cn: 允许自己或他人享受某种令人愉悦的事物，常常达到过度或无节制的程度，尤其当这种行为可能被视为不恰当或不健康时。
definitions.example_en: She was indulging in chocolate every evening after dinner.
definitions.example_cn: 她每天晚饭后都沉溺于吃巧克力。

definitions.explanation_en: To yield to someone's desires or demands, especially a child or someone you care for, often out of affection or weakness.
definitions.explanation_cn: 出于喜爱或软弱，顺从某人的愿望或要求，尤指对孩子或亲近之人。
definitions.example_en: Her grandparents always indulged her with toys and sweets.
definitions.example_cn: 她的祖父母总是用玩具和糖果纵容她。

definitions.explanation_en: To give free rein to one's emotions, impulses, or habits, often without restraint or self-control.
definitions.explanation_cn: 任由自己的情绪、冲动或习惯自由发泄，通常缺乏节制或自控。
definitions.example_en: He was indulging in self-pity after the breakup, refusing to move on.
definitions.example_cn: 分手后，他沉溺于自怜，拒绝向前看。

comparison.analysis: “Permit” (允许) 是中性词，指正式或非正式地给予许可，不带有情感色彩或程度暗示。而 “indulging” 隐含了纵容、过度满足的意味，常带负面或同情的语气，强调放任而非单纯授权。
“Cater” (迎合) 指为满足他人需求而提供服务或便利，通常是出于职业责任或礼貌，不一定涉及放纵。而 “indulging” 更强调满足欲望，尤其是非必要的、奢侈的或有害的欲望，带有情感上的迁就。
“Yield” (让步) 指在压力、争论或要求下放弃立场，常用于权力或意见的对抗情境。而 “indulging” 更侧重于主动给予满足，源于情感软弱或爱意，而非被迫妥协。
